1.rationale:
Let's think this through...

I'm currently at position (2, 4) and there's an apple at (8, 4), which is 6 units to my right. I could try to head towards that apple, but I'd have to navigate around the enemy snake at (5, 6) to avoid running into it.

However, there's also an apple at (6, 1), which is only 4 units to my right and 3 units down. This might be a safer and more immediate option.

My strategy for now will be to aim for the apple at (6, 1) and then reassess the situation after I've eaten it.

Decided next move: RIGHT.

2.rationale:
To maximize points, I should aim to collect apples while avoiding collisions. The closest apple to my snake is at (6, 8), which is directly above my current position at (5, 6). However, moving directly up would put me in danger of colliding with my own tail if I continue to grow without moving horizontally. Therefore, I should move towards the apple at (6, 8) while also positioning myself to easily collect the apple at (8, 4) after that.

To achieve this, I should first move to the right to avoid any immediate danger of running into myself or the walls. This will also put me in a better position to collect the apple at (8, 4) after I've collected the one at (6, 8). After moving right to (6, 6), I can then move up to (6, 5), and then left to (5, 5), which will allow me to move up to (5, 4) and then right to collect the apple at (6, 4). After that, I can move down to (6, 6) and then right to (6, 5) to collect the apple at (6, 6). This plan will help me avoid running into myself and maximize my points by collecting apples efficiently.

Based on this strategy, my next move should be: RIGHT.

For the next turn, I should remember that I will be moving towards the apple at (6, 8) and then maneuvering to collect the apple at (8, 4) while avoiding any collisions.
